title: University logo - serif
content:
I am trying to find out what font this is! (obviously)

I've attached the full logo and a close up of "university" for extra reference. I know that some of the letters such as the 'R' in Washburn have been altered. I am wondering if this font was specially designed for the logo? I can't find it anywhere.

Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [washburn-logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193540/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-2_33.jpg) | 126.82 KB |
| [university-closeup.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193540/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_113.jpg) | 78.47 KB |
author: englande

comments.content:
I think I found it...

Holland Seminar by Hollis Holland

[http://www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/holland-seminar/regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193540/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/holland-seminar/regular "http://www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/holland-seminar/regular")
